```{r, include = FALSE}

library(dplyr)
library(dbplyr)
library(DBI)
library(dbplot)
library(purrr)

# Class catchup
con <- DBI::dbConnect(odbc::odbc(), "Postgres Dev")
airports <- tbl(con, in_schema("datawarehouse", "airport"))
flights <- tbl(con, in_schema("datawarehouse", "flight"))
carriers <- tbl(con, in_schema("datawarehouse", "carrier"))

airline_list <- carriers %>%  
  select(carrier, carriername) %>%   
  collect()  %>%                     
  split(.$carriername) %>%           
  map(~.$carrier)     

```

## Connect to RSC
*Use RStudio Connect to publish work internally in the enterprise*

1. Open the dashboard `app.R` file

2. Click on File

3. Click on Publish

4. Connect Account click Next

5. Select RStudio Connect

<img src="images/select-connect.PNG" width = 400>

6. Copy and paste **your** RStudio Server URL and add `:3939`

<img src="images/rsc-server.PNG" width = 400>

7. Enter your credentials

8. Complete the form

9. Click Proceed

10. Click on Connect

11. Click Publish
